House Bill/Resolution NO. PS00029
FULL TITLE : SAD PLIGHT OF OFWs
SHORT TITLE : King Saud's Directive For Foreign Workers
ABSTRACT : Rep. Bertiz rose to relate the confirmation of the royal directives issued by His Majesty King Salman bin Abdulaziz al Saud of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia regarding the protection of the rights of foreign workers, including the 11,000 overseas Filipino workers (OFWs) based at Saudi Oger and other similarly situated companies. He stressed that the problems of the OFWs did not happen overnight, and underscored how the present Administration has quickly and concretely acted on their situation. After mentioning that he filed House Resolution No. 13 urging the Department of Labor and Employment (DOLE) and the Department of Foreign Affairs (DFA) to help the stranded OFWs in Saudi Arabia, Rep. Bertiz disclosed that the ACTS-OFW Party-List has also initiated a dialogue between the families of said workers and various government agencies to identify the government programs involved. He said that he would join the government’s crisis team to Saudi Arabia, being the lone Representative of the OFW sector in the House of Representatives. Finally, as a former OFW who has also experienced the hardships and sacrifices of stranded overseas workers, he sought for the approval of House Resolution No. 157 thanking King Salman of Saudi Arabia for his act of benevolence and compassion, and also honoring and thanking President Duterte for mobilizing government resources to address the problem. INTERPELLATION OF REP. BELARO Recognized by the Chair on motion of Rep. Tugna, Rep. Salvador B. Belaro Jr. inquired why the problems of the OFWs in Saudi Arabia were resolved through foreign intervention and not by the national government. He also inquired into the role of the DOLE and the DFA on the issue. He lamented the deplorable handling of the situation of the OFWs, and suggested the filing of a resolution investigating the government officials concerned. Agreeing therewith, Rep. Bertiz said that the Office of the Undersecretary for Migrant Workers’ Affairs in particular should be investigated. He sought support for House Resolution No. 194 which he authored seeking for the creation of the Department of Migration and Development to address the exclusive needs of the OFWs. (SOURCE: House Journal No.7,p.47)
